title: 1967 Ferrari 330 GT 2+2 Series II
description: This 1967 Ferrari 330 GT 2+2 is one of 455 Series II examples produced between 1965 and 1967. Chassis 9129 underwent a refurbishment that was performed by The Vintage Connection of Oklahoma City between 2002 and 2015, and was purchased by the current owner later that year. The car is finished in silver over blue leather upholstery, and power comes from a 4.0-liter Colombo V12 paired with a five-speed manual gearbox. Equipment includes triple Weber carburetors, a limited-slip differential, an ANSA quad-exit exhaust, power steering, servo-assisted four-wheel disc brakes, 15” Borrani wire wheels, power windows, and a Becker AM/FM radio. Maintenance performed in April 2025 included the removal and adjustment of the transmission, a rebuild of a power window switch, and a fluid service. This 330 GT is now offered on dealer consignment with copies of build documents, factory literature, tools, spare parts, refurbishment photos and records, and a clean California title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 1967 Ferrari 330 GT 2+2 Series II at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #198,516.

The 4.0-liter Colombo Tipo 209 V12 breathes through triple Weber carburetors, and it was factory rated at 300 horsepower. The engine and carburetors were rebuilt during the refurbishment, and the following work was also performed:

  • Resurfacing the cylinder heads and the installation of replacement valve seats, Teflon valve guides, and Manley single-piece stainless-steel valves by Autosport Seattle

A pair of winch rings was added to the front cross member during the refurbishment.

Included spare parts, tools, and factory literature are presented in the gallery.
